name: MOSAEIC Memory System
summary: A robust episodic-to-semantic memory scaffold consisting of FiveWindowCapture (Mental, Observation, Senses, Actions, Emotions) and TurningPoint to preserve high-emotion episodes and enable long-term knowledge stability.
core_logic: Encodes episodic-to-semantic transformation with temporal windowing (FiveWindowCapture) and TurningPoint for high-emotion preservation.

name: BeliefRewrite & MaladaptivePattern
summary: Mechanisms for memory reconsolidation and tracking recurring suboptimal patterns to facilitate better long-term behavioral alignment.
core_logic: Memory reconsolidation framework enabling belief updates and pattern tracking to improve long-term behavior alignment.

name: Pattern Evolution Tracker & Basin Reorganization
summary: Encodes how patterns evolve across projects; energy-based basin dynamics guide learning and generalization.
core_logic: Energy-based basin dynamics modeling evolution of patterns to foster robust generalization across tasks.

name: OODA Loop with Energy Budgeting
summary: Observe, Orient, Decide, Act cycles embedded as a cognitive rhythm with explicit energy budgeting, shaping timing and prioritization of actions.
rationale: By budgeting cognitive energy, OODA cycles become efficient, timely, and aligned with resource constraints.

name: Graphiti/Neo4j as Single Source of Truth with Temporal Validity and Provenance
summary: Graphiti/Neo4j serves as the single source of truth with temporal validity (valid_at/invalid_at) and provenance metadata to support auditable decision traces.
rationale: Provides auditable, time-bound data lineage enabling reproducible and trustworthy decision-making.

name: MCP Bridge Pattern for Tool Decoupling
summary: Decouples cognition from tools, enabling safe, testable, and resilient tool usage via ToolCollection.from_mcp.
rationale: Promotes safe tool integration and repeatable experimentation by isolating cognitive reasoning from tool interfaces.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: Schema comprising PainPoint, Objection, Desire, Belief, Behavior, VoicePattern, and FailedSolution enabling granular, personalized client engagement and provenance persistence.
core_logic: Structured graph schema for avatar modeling with persistent provenance across client interactions.

name: Specialized Smolagents & AvatarResearcher Orchestrator
summary: Specialized smolagents (PainAnalyst, ObjectionHandler, VoiceExtractor) plus an AvatarResearcher orchestrator enable scalable, modular avatar research workflows.
core_logic: Modular agent roles and orchestration to scale avatar research pipelines.

name: Ground-Truth Ingestion (IAS-copy-brief.md)
summary: Ground-truth ingestion drives a reliable starting point for avatar modeling; bulk ingestion and Graphiti integration ensure provenance preservation.
core_logic: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as avatar ground truth; bulk ingestion and Graphiti integration ensure provenance preservation.

name: Rapid Observe-Orient-Decide-Act Cycles
summary: The log demonstrates quick scanning, contextual orientation (distinguishing real files from AppleDouble metadata), decisive action, and immediate feedback.
rationale: Fast OODA cycles enable rapid situational awareness and timely responses.

name: Pragmatic Data Hygiene
summary: Prioritize cleanup of unnecessary assets (e.g., .srt files) while acknowledging metadata artifacts; distinguish operational data from metadata.
rationale: Maintains data quality and reduces noise by routine data hygiene practices.

name: Preserve Provenance & Auditability
summary: Record session identifiers, timestamps, actions, and outcomes to support traceability and accountability.
rationale: Ensures reproducibility and accountability through traceable data lineage.

name: Idempotent & Auditable Actions
summary: Actions can be repeated without adverse effects; provide clear success/failure reporting to enable repeatability.
rationale: Supports safe experimentation and reliable re-execution.

name: Ground Truth Ingestion (Canonical Reference)
summary: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as the avatar ground truth; establishes a canonical reference for avatar research; enables Graphiti/Neo4j ingestion and downstream knowledge modeling.
core_logic: Ingest IAS-copy-brief.md as canonical reference; sources: 010-heartbeat-handoff, 019-avatar-knowledge-graph; enables Graphiti/Neo4j ingestion and downstream knowledge modeling.

name: Episodic-to-Semantic Memory
summary: Explicit episodic-to-semantic memory consolidation with time-based decay, turning points, and automatic consolidation triggers to stabilize long-term knowledge.
core_logic: Explicit episodic-to-semantic memory consolidation with time-based decay, turning points, and automatic consolidation triggers to stabilize long-term knowledge.

name: Trajectory-aware Context
summary: ContextBuilder provides trajectories; decision adapter includes trajectories in the agent context; enables trajectory-aware reasoning in OODA loop.
core_logic: Expose trajectory data to the decision context to enable trajectory-aware reasoning within the OODA loop.

name: MCP Bridge Resilience
summary: Tool loading via ToolCollection.from_mcp decouples agents from the existence of individual tools, increasing robustness to tool deletions.
core_logic: Decouple tool availability from agents by loading tools through a collection interface, reducing fragility to tool deletion.

name: Avatar Knowledge Graph Schema
summary: Graph schema design (PainPoint, Objection, Desire, Belief, Behavior, VoicePattern, etc.) and Graphiti/Neo4j integration to support rich avatar modeling.
core_logic: Define a graph schema for avatars and enable Graphiti/Neo4j integration to model rich agent personas.

name: Explicit termination signals as boundary markers in constrained environments
summary: Explicit termination signals function as boundary markers in constrained interactive environments.

name: Graceful termination and provenance preservation for non-actionable content
summary: When content is non-actionable, the prudent pattern is to gracefully terminate and preserve provenance.

name: Provenance-first traceability
summary: Preserving provenance metadata (session ID, timestamps) is essential for traceable wisdom extraction.

name: Read-to-understand-first
summary: Read-to-understand-first: establish context by reading files/codebase before taking action

name: Environment awareness
summary: Environment awareness: respect system states and constraints (TodoWrite disabled, OpenSpec presence)

name: Modular exploration
summary: Modular exploration: decompose into documentation (CLAUDE.md), architecture (Archon MCP), interfaces (OpenSpec)

name: Documentation as navigation anchor
summary: Documentation as navigation anchor: use Core CLAUDE.md as foundational reference

name: Provenance-first reference
summary: Provenance-first: preserve traceability and source metadata from the outset

name: Iterative discovery
summary: Iterative discovery: incremental reading, summarizing, and validating before proceeding

name: Observe phase
summary: Observe: read relevant files; understand codebase structure

name: Orient phase
summary: Orient: note system state (OpenSpec status); recognize access controls (TodoWrite disabled)

name: Decide phase
summary: Decide: determine next exploration focus (OpenSpec, codebase)

name: Act-Phase Targeted Exploration
summary: In the Act phase, begin targeted exploration of the environment (e.g., survey first pages, docs) to surface actionable signals while anchoring exploration to provenance and planning context.
rationale: Targets efficient information-gathering and reduces risk by anchoring exploration to concrete interfaces and documentation.

name: Renormalised Generative Models (RGM) for Hierarchical Planning
summary: RGM enables scale-free, hierarchical planning by coarse-graining state representations across levels, maintaining tractable inference while expanding planning horizons.
rationale: Coarse-graining preserves essential structure while enabling multi-level planning across wide state spaces.

name: Active Inference Loop: Perceive–Plan–Act
summary: Active Inference provides a principled loop: perceive (update beliefs from observations), plan (evaluate actions via expected free energy), and act (update policies), closing the perception-action cycle.
core_logic: Belief updating drives both action and future predictions; action policies are optimized to minimize expected free energy.

name: Hierarchical Generative Core (A,B,C,D,E)
summary: Core tensors A, B, C, D, E encode likelihoods, transitions, path dynamics, and priors, forming a structured generative model across hierarchy.
core_logic: Tensor components map observations to latent states, encode transition dynamics, and constrain priors across hierarchy.

name: Memory-Integrated Autobiographical Agents
summary: Memory integration (episodic, semantic, procedural, strategic) is essential for autobiographical agents and informs planning through learned priors.
core_logic: Memory systems provide priors and experiential data that shape predictions and decisions.

name: Embodied Enactive Design and Autopoiesis
summary: Embodied enactive design (self/non-self boundary, autopoiesis) supports attachment to diverse interfaces and robust adaptation.
core_logic: Agency arises from ongoing self-organization balanced with external coupling.

name: Mature Workflow Practices as System Architecture
summary: Mature workflow practices (TDD, feature branches, Serena search, Archon, Neo4j schemas, CI) are treated as first-class components of system architecture.
rationale: Engineering practices must be embedded in architecture to ensure reliability, traceability, and maintainability.

name: Visualization and Narration for Interpretability
summary: Visualization and narration (cartpole_live, cartpole_narrated) provide interpretable traces of internal thinking, aiding validation and trust.
core_logic: External traces map internal decisions to observable narratives for auditing.

name: Explicit Provenance and Logging
summary: Provenance is preserved through explicit session IDs, milestone logs, commits, test coverage, and documented architecture decisions.
rationale: Preserving provenance enables reproducibility, auditing, and trust.

name: System-First Mental Model
summary: Mental Model: System-first orientation, observe-before-action, iterative learning, and provenance-centric analytics.
core_logic: Prioritize holistic system understanding before optimizing parts.

name: Observe–Orient–Decide–Act (OODA) in Codebase
summary: Observe → Orient → Decide → Act: the log demonstrates an OODA-like cycle with observing the codebase and system state, orienting to tasks, deciding on the next actions, and acting by exploring pages and directories.
core_logic: Cycle-based reasoning aligns observation with task-driven action.

name: Exploration Discipline: Understand Before Acting
summary: Exploration discipline: Start with understanding the environment (codebase, status of Archon) before taking concrete actions.
rationale: A foundational discipline to prevent rash changes and improve alignment with goals.

name: Provenance Emphasis in Exploration
summary: Provenance emphasis: Metadata and session provenance are treated as core elements to preserve during exploration.
rationale: Preserves context and decisions across exploration sessions.

name: Plan-Based Phased Deployment
summary: Plan-based phased deployment (Phases A/B) with staged milestones.
rationale: Phased deployment reduces risk and enables incremental validation.

name: Spec-Driven Governance (SpecKit)
summary: Spec-driven governance (SpecKit, 001-006 specs, checklists, /speckit workflows)
rationale: Explicit specifications and workflows govern behavior and quality.

name: MultiEnvironmentDeploymentWithSecureNetworking
summary: Multi-environment deployment pattern (local dev vs VPS deployment) with explicit networking (docker networks) and secure access controls
rationale: Ensures consistent deployment across environments and enforces network isolation and secure access policies.

name: IncrementalKnowledgeGraphConstruction
summary: Incremental knowledge graph construction (Graphiti ingestion, entity/relationship extraction, provenance)
rationale: Builds a living semantic model with traceable provenance for every inference.

name: MemoryArchitectureAndSelfStructureAwareness
summary: Memory architecture framing (5-layer memory + autobiographical layer) and self-structure awareness

name: OODAInspiredDecisionCycle
summary: OODA-like decision cycles evidenced by Observe (state discovery), Orient (plan/architecture), Decide (deployment/testing), Act (ingest/test/commit)
rationale: Implements a rapid, looped feedback mechanism for deployment and data ingestion with disciplined branching.

name: ProvenanceCentricWorkflow
summary: Provenance-centric workflow (plan docs, commits, Archon/Plan mode, memory of decisions)
rationale: Anchors decisions in traceable plans and commit histories to improve auditability.

name: BatchProcessingToManageComplexity
summary: Batch processing approach (Batch 1 complete, Batch 2 pending) to manage complexity
rationale: Segments work to reduce cognitive load and validate increments before proceeding.

name: RiskMitigationAndAccessControlPatterns
summary: Risk/mitigation patterns (revoking SSH access, environment variable handling, health checks)
rationale: Defines concrete controls to reduce security and reliability risks during operations.

name: ConstraintAwareProblemSolving
summary: Operate within explicit capabilities and read-only limits; plan tasks accordingly.

name: ReadOnlyExploration
summary: Search and analyze codebase with non-destructive methods (Glob, Grep, Read tools).

name: ExplicitCapabilityDeclaration
summary: Clearly state what I can do and what I cannot do to avoid scope creep.

name: ModularAnalysis
summary: Break problem into code search, file navigation, and pattern reporting.

name: ProvenanceFirstReporting
summary: Preserve origin metadata for all findings to support traceability.

name: MetaLearningFromLogs
summary: Infer patterns and opportunities for improvement from transcript data.

name: DependencyAwareWorkflow
summary: Design processes with explicit checks for essential services (e.g., Archon MCP) and define fallback paths when dependencies are unavailable.

name: ProvenanceFirstDesign
summary: Preserve and attach provenance metadata to outputs to enable traceability across the wisdom extraction workflow.

name: Fault-tolerant orchestration
summary: Recognize that optional components or non-critical services can be skipped or rerouted when unavailable, enabling graceful degradation.
core_logic: Graceful degradation achieved by skipping or rerouting non-critical components when unavailable.

name: Observability-driven decision making
summary: Use observable states (server connectivity, task discovery status) to orient and decide on next actions.
core_logic: Decisions are guided by real-time observable system states.

name: Modular task discovery
summary: Separate discovery (what tasks exist) from execution (performing tasks) to enable flexible adaptation when blockers occur.
core_logic: Decouple discovery from execution to adapt to blockers without stalling progress.

name: Decompose-and-Phase
summary: Break complex initiatives into well-defined phases (ingestion, metadata, deduplication, CLI, search, maintenance) to constrain scope and enable staged value delivery.
rationale: Constrains scope and enables staged value delivery by dividing work into phases.

name: Provenance-First
summary: Capture and preserve metadata about decisions, actions, and sources at every step to enable auditability and reproducibility.
rationale: Ensures traceability and reproducibility of outcomes.

name: Prioritized Execution
summary: Sort tasks by descending priority (100 to 60) to tackle high-impact work first.
rationale: Focuses on high-value work and reduces resistance from lower-priority tasks.

name: Automation-Driven Creation
summary: Automate project creation and artifact generation from source docs to reduce drift.
rationale: Minimizes drift between source documents and produced artifacts.

name: Iterative Refinement
summary: Use short feedback loops to validate alignment and adapt plans accordingly.
rationale: Enables course correction through rapid feedback.

name: Observe stage
summary: Scan the log and docs to understand landscape

name: Orient stage
summary: Infer project goals, architecture, and constraints from logs

name: Decide stage
summary: Determine priority ordering and default assignments

name: Act stage
summary: Execute project creation, task instantiation, and provenance logging

name: Feedback stage
summary: Review outcomes (task counts, IDs) and refine next steps

name: Readiness and Compliance Posture
summary: Readiness and compliance posture (evidenced by 'Core CLAUDE.md read')

name: System-State Awareness
summary: System-state awareness (evidenced by 'Archon MCP active (TodoWrite disabled)')

name: Warmup-driven Interaction Pattern
summary: A deliberate pre-action phase that seeks tasks before acting to reduce misalignment and wasted effort. It involves prompting for objectives, confirming scope, and aligning expectations before proceeding.
rationale: Reduces scope drift and improves task relevance by frontloading task discovery.

name: Explicit Task Scoping
summary: Before acting, ask clarifying questions to define goals, success criteria, and boundaries; enumerate the tasks required to complete the objective.
rationale: Prevents ambiguity and guides subsequent decisions and actions.

name: Observe: System State and Active Tasks
summary: Perform a structured observation: check current system state (resources, context) and assess active tasks to establish a baseline before choosing next steps.
core_logic: Monitor environment, detect tasks, update situational awareness, and feed into subsequent Orientation.

name: Orient: Interpret Constraints and Warmup Context
summary: Interpret external constraints (e.g., CLAUDE.md, MCP) and recognize warmup context to frame actions within permitted boundaries.
core_logic: Map constraints and contextual cues to capability space; maintain policy alignment.

name: Decide: Seek User Instruction Before Action
summary: Prefer requesting explicit user instructions over autonomous action; defer decision-making until guidance is obtained.
rationale: Maintains alignment with user goals and reduces risk of unintended actions.

name: Act: Await User Instruction; No Action Prematurely
summary: Do not execute actions until explicit instruction is provided; conserve cognitive and operational resources until confirmed tasks exist.
rationale: Prevents unintended consequences and drift from user intent.

name: Provenance-aware Logging
summary: Preserve provenance for traceability by capturing source logs, session IDs, timestamps, and notes; feed into knowledge-graph ingestion for traceable lineage.
core_logic: Systematically structure provenance metadata for future retrieval.

name: Session Continuity via Attractor Memory
summary: Startup context is reconstructed by an attractor-based memory pipeline and injected at session start to maintain continuity across sessions.
core_logic: Use attractor-based memory to retrieve and inject startup context.

name: Prefetched Tasks Pattern
summary: Prefetch local Archon tasks and send to VPS to bridge network isolation while preserving latency bounds, ensuring readiness to act when permitted.
core_logic: Pre-fetch and forward tasks to maintain responsiveness under isolation.

name: Episodic Memory Retrieval via Graphiti
summary: When Archon data is insufficient, prefer graph-backed episodic memories to support reasoning and decision making.
core_logic: Query graph-backed memories to fill gaps.

name: Progressive Disclosure
summary: Inject only compact, provenance-rich context; store raw memories for future expansion to balance immediacy with long-term knowledge growth.
rationale: Ensures usable context now while preserving richer data for future expansion.

name: Provenance Preservation
summary: Maintain source metadata (project, task IDs, fragment types, and lineage) to support traceability and provenance across fragments.
core_logic: Design and enforce a provenance metadata schema.

name: Constraint-driven Analysis
summary: Operate within read-only constraints and plan steps before acting to minimize risky or unauthorized actions.
rationale: Policy-compliant pre-planning reduces risk.

name: Scope-first Inquiry
summary: Ask clarifying questions about what to search and analyze to define scope early and avoid drift.
rationale: Clarifies objectives and boundaries.

name: Observability and Meta-data Awareness
summary: Capture session IDs, timestamps, platform; maintain provenance for visibility and auditability across interactions.
core_logic: Instrumentation and logging hooks to gather and preserve session metadata.

name: Search-First Information Gathering
summary: Leverage retrieval to build understanding before coding.

name: Non-destructive Exploration
summary: Prefer exploration of logs and data rather than altering files.

name: Provenance-First Governance
summary: Preserve provenance metadata and reproducibility.

name: Ontological Framing and Credibility
summary: Mental models: Problems are framed in ontological terms (empty/hollow) rather than mere situational pain; credibility relies on data, peer validation, and transparent trade-offs; avoid 'inner work' framing; present authenticity as strategic, not therapeutic.

name: OODA-Oriented Communication
summary: OODA-oriented communication: Observe credibility signals (data, credentials, peer reps); Orient by mapping values to measurable outcomes (performance, risk management, isolation); Decide to present precise, evidence-based claims with explicit trade-offs; Act with actionable, high-signal content and references.

name: Sensitive Topics - Skill-Building Framing
summary: Frame emotional work as skill-building (not therapy), acknowledge shame without judgment, use mechanical/somatic metaphors, and maintain a focus on performance and mastery rather than healing.

name: Intellectual Expectations and Precision
summary: Respect complexity, use precise language, cite research, acknowledge trade-offs, tailor messaging to their field (surgeon, founder, tech exec).

name: Seen vs Sold: Authentic Competence
summary: What makes them feel seen vs sold: See their isolation and paradoxes, validate real pain despite success, avoid patronizing or overpromising language; emphasize competence, ROI, and authentic expertise.

name: Big-Picture Architecture First
summary: Prioritize understanding the overall system structure and cross-file relationships before delving into code or implementation details.
core_logic: Global view before detail.

name: DRY / Avoid Redundancy
summary: Minimize repetition; avoid duplicating analysis; compile insights with provenance.
core_logic: Do not repeat yourself; consolidate with provenance.

name: Layered Architecture & Separation of Concerns
summary: Treat infra DI framework, BlockSuite integration, frontend/backend/native modules as distinct layers with defined interaction surfaces.
core_logic: Layered design with clear interfaces.

name: Provenance-Aware Reasoning
summary: Record and attach provenance to each insight (session IDs, source URLs, files) for traceability.
core_logic: Attach provenance to all reasoning.

name: Incremental / Guided Delivery
summary: Provide high-level guidance first, then more detail; avoid overwhelming with low-value content.
core_logic: Progress from high-level to detail to prevent overload.

name: OODA Loop in Workflow
summary: Observe repository state, Orient by synthesizing findings, Decide on deliverable, Act by producing the artifact; iterate.
core_logic: Cycle Observe-Orient-Decide-Act within workflows.

name: CTC Core Philosophy
summary: Coaching The Conversion: transformation must occur within the prospect before, during, and through the sales process; the conversion coach guides belief shifts across the entire funnel.
rationale: Principles: Transformation-before-sale; Coaching conversion through copy; Build prospect responsiveness; Applications: Frame messaging, structure copy hierarchy, increase engagement.

name: SPIAD Framework
summary: Sales Page In A Day: a 15-section template organized to coach transformation across a single asset.
core_logic: A modular, 15-section sequence guiding transformation of a single asset from gap discovery to exit gap.

name: 3D Avatar: Prospect Dimensions
summary: Dynamic, living understanding of the prospect across three dimensions: Demographics, Everyday Psychographics, and Charged-Up Ethos Graphics.
core_logic: An evolving, multi-dimensional representation of the prospect used for personalization and targeting.

name: MoHT & MoHP (Moment of Highest Tension / Moment of Highest Pleasure)
summary: MoHT captures a hyper-specific, filmable problem moment; MoHP captures the redemption point after the problem is solved.
core_logic: Center messaging on concrete tensions and redemption to drive action.

name: Sacred Cows
summary: Identify and slaughter limiting beliefs and paradigms that hinder progress; replace with empowering beliefs.
core_logic: Diagnose false beliefs and reframe objections as opportunities via new beliefs.

name: The Starbucks Test (100 Words per Minute Rule)
summary: Copy length should align with the time needed to coach the conversion; longer assets for longer decisions, shorter for quick decisions.
core_logic: Match length to decision complexity and pacing to optimize engagement and comprehension.

name: Enrollment Extractor & Launch Bible
summary: Mining high-conversion calls to extract messaging; the Launch Bible compiles all insights for funnel creation.
core_logic: Preserve client voice and aha moments; sign off on insights before heavy writing.

name: Divergent Roads & Market's Search for Meaning
summary: Present parallel realities (with/without product) at multiple time checkpoints; reframe past failures as prerequisites for progress.
core_logic: Frame decision points by showing two viable realities to illuminate risk and opportunity.

name: Migration-driven OpenSpec Consolidation: WHAT vs HOW
summary: Migration-driven consolidation: unify legacy specs into a single OpenSpec capability with distinct WHAT vs HOW.
rationale: Consolidates legacy specs into a unified capability with clear WHAT vs HOW distinctions.

name: Governance-first Architecture: Graph Channel Enforcement
summary: Governance-first architecture: enforce Graph Channel usage and CI checks to block direct driver access.
rationale: Enforce governance to ensure auditable, secure access.

name: Staged Validation Mindset: Tiered Migration Checks
summary: Staged validation mindset: guide migration with Tiered checks (count, content, functional).
rationale: Mitigate risk by validating across dimensions before progression.

name: Provenance-centric Engineering: Lineage through Session Metadata
summary: Provenance-centric engineering: preserve session metadata and source logs for lineage tracking.
rationale: Maintain traceability of insights and decisions.

name: Hybrid Search Philosophy: Vector, Full-Text, and Graph Discovery
summary: Hybrid search philosophy: blend vector indexing, full-text, and graph traversal for robust discovery.

name: Provenance-aware Design: Auditable Metadata for Wisdom Extraction
summary: Provenance-aware design: maintain explicit metadata for auditable wisdom extraction.

name: Performance-first Constraints: Latency Targets Early
summary: Performance-first constraints: embed latency targets early to steer architecture decisions.

name: Entity-centric Evolution: Migrate Core Ontology for Graph Integrity
summary: Entity-centric evolution: migrate core ontology (Architecture, Episode, Attractor Basin, etc.) to preserve graph integrity.

name: Safe, Read-Only Exploration
summary: Operate in a safe, non-destructive mode (read-only) to minimize risk while exploring.
core_logic: Inspect and reason without mutating state; rely on observation and non-destructive queries to gather information.

name: Scoped Discovery Before Deep Dive
summary: Start with scoped discovery (search for files, patterns) before deep-diving into code or conversations.
core_logic: Limit initial scope to high-signal areas; gather context before committing cognitive effort to deep analysis.

name: Provenance & Reproducibility Emphasis
summary: Prioritize provenance and auditability; capture sources, decisions, and context for reproducibility.
core_logic: Record sources, decisions, and context so analyses can be traced and reproduced.

name: Pattern Extraction Across Interactions
summary: Extract recurring themes across interactions to build transferable patterns (patterns over single data points).
core_logic: Cluster observations to reveal stable patterns rather than overfitting to isolated data points.

name: Clarification-Driven Scope Bounding
summary: Use clarifying questions to bound scope and reduce cognitive load; iterative refinement is preferred.
core_logic: Ask targeted questions to tighten requirements and progressively refine the task.

name: OODA Loop in Practice
summary: OODA loop as a fundamental pattern: Observe status, Orient to architecture and dependencies, Decide on the next phase, and Act through concrete commands and commits, iterating rapidly.
core_logic: Cycle through Observe-Orient-Decide-Act to make fast, informed decisions and take concrete actions.

name: Phase-based Orchestration with Gates
summary: Work is organized into clearly defined phases (Import, Sync, Archive, Documentation) with explicit gates and milestones, enabling risk-managed progression.
rationale: Defines stopping points to manage risk and ensure readiness before moving to the next phase.

name: Bidirectional Synchronization
summary: Maintain a two-way linkage between OpenSpec and Archon via .archon-project-id to preserve provenance and ensure consistent state across systems.
rationale: Two-way linkage ensures updates propagate and provenance remains intact across systems.

name: Provenance & Auditability
summary: Preserve provenance metadata (session IDs, commit IDs, timestamps, task IDs) to support traceability and reproducibility.
rationale: Metadata-driven traceability enables auditability and reproducibility of outcomes.

name: Authoritative State Priority in Conflicts
summary: When conflict arises between sources, give priority to the authoritative state (Archon) for updates; manual overrides can prevent regression.
core_logic: Favor canonical or authoritative source to resolve conflicts and avoid regressions.

name: Automation-First Ethos
summary: Rely on automation (slash commands, scripts) to minimize manual toil and reduce human error in repetitive coordination tasks.
core_logic: Automate repetitive workflows to reduce errors and speed up coordination.

name: Validation-Driven Archiving
summary: Archive is conditioned on complete validation; provide actionable remediation guidance and explicit error messages for incomplete states.
rationale: Ensure archives reflect validated states and guide remediation when validation fails.

name: Documentation as Living Artifact
summary: Docs (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md) evolve with the system, embedding current capabilities and usage patterns to keep mental models aligned.
rationale: Living documentation aligns users with current capabilities and practices.

name: Startup Readiness Gate
summary: Startup protocol as a readiness gate: perform core checks before diving into tasks (e.g., 'Core CLAUDE.md read', 'Archon MCP active').
core_logic: Require essential prerequisites to be verified before task engagement.

name: Early Task Discovery
summary: Task discovery early: performing OpenSpec checks and task discovery to constrain scope and align expectations.
core_logic: Identify high-signal tasks early to bound scope and set expectations.

name: OODA Pattern for System Startup
summary: Observe-Orient-Decide-Act (OODA) pattern visible in sequence: Observe system state (docs read, components), Orient to capabilities (OpenSpec, MCP), Decide on next steps (task discovery), Act (initiate startup steps).

name: Provenance-Preserving Output
summary: Explicit provenance consideration: metadata like session IDs, timestamps, and source references should be preserved in outputs.
rationale: Preserve traceability and auditability of outputs.

name: Modularity and Pluggability
summary: Modularity and pluggability: reliance on OpenSpec suggests a mental model favoring modular specs for scalable capability.

name: Warmup as Risk Reduction
summary: Warmup checks serve as preflight to validate readiness and reduce downstream errors.

name: Environment-First Mental Model
summary: Prioritize understanding the information ecology (inputs, context, constraints) before acting; reduces misinterpretation and guides targeted analysis.

name: Provenance-Preserving Practice
summary: Capture source metadata and lineage for every insight to enable traceability and auditability.
rationale: Anchors insights to their origins to support accountability.

name: Iterative Refinement
summary: Initiate with coarse summaries and progressively refine as more content becomes available or clarified.

name: OODA-Driven Operation
summary: Favor rapid Observe-Orient-Decide-Act cycles with explicit feedback loops to stabilize understanding in sparse-content scenarios.

name: Sparseness-Resilient Reasoning
summary: When data is sparse, declare assumptions clearly and avoid over-claiming; build insights from minimal viable signals.

name: Fidelity-First Funnel Replication
summary: In high-conversion workflows, replicating a proven template (Todd's OTO page) with exact typography, colors, and structure tends to preserve performance and avoid regressions caused by superficial changes.
rationale: Preserves performance by avoiding uncontrolled changes.

name: OODA Loop: Observation → Decide → Act
summary: Constantly observe asset integrity (hero image presence, font sizing, color palette) and promptly decide to revert to or copy proven assets when deviations threaten conversions; act by updating HTML/CSS to align with the reference.

name: Provenance-anchored Adaptation
summary: All changes and decisions are anchored to the origin: the original Unbounce/Todd pages and the supplied content. This ensures traceability and defensibility of design choices.
rationale: Anchored to origin for traceability and defensibility.

name: Mosaic-Mapping Readiness
summary: Capturing Senses, Actions, Emotions, Impulses, Cognitions (S.A.E.I.C.) reveals tensions between aesthetic fidelity and functional constraints (e.g., missing hero image, asset URLs).

name: Voice Consistency Principle
summary: Maintaining the established page voice (conversational, direct, conversion-focused) is critical to sustaining audience trust and conversions across sections.
rationale: Consistent voice sustains trust and conversions.
